title: Drawing, 1825–35
medium: Pen and ink, with ink washers on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in brown ink, at lower right, cut off: N (?)
provenance: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council from the collection of Leon Decloux.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Design for a tureen, with alternate  schemes of decoration.  Horizontal Rectangle. The left half of the vessel is decorated with a handle composed of a cornucopia and the base is banded with a grapevine meander and rests on a paw foot. The right half is banded by a repeating palmette motif and handle in the form of a plant stalk.  Finial unadorned L.r.  (in brown ink), cut off: "N (?)".
